Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk iwl1000-firmware
exit 0

exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: linux-firmware bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The linux-firmware packages contain all of the firmware files that are required by various devices to operate. This update fixes the following bug: Firmware files for no longer supported hardware have been removed from the linux-firmware packages. (BZ#1016595) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: A firmware file for the Myricom 10GbE driver has been updated to a newer version. (BZ#1063702) As various Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) require newer QLogic firmware, the firmware has been updated for Generation 4 and Generation 8 adapters. (BZ#1089364) A firmware file for the Broadcom 10GbE driver has been updated to a newer version. (BZ#1089403) A firmware file for the new Quick Assist Technology (qat) driver has been added to the linux-firmware packages to support this new driver. (BZ#1127338) A firmware file for the Chelsio cxgb4 driver has been updated to a newer version. (BZ#1144116) Users of linux-firmware are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
